content:
Hi everyone,

Currently in mathlib, IsSeparable is treated differently from IsIntegral. We have

  1. RingHom.IsIntegralElem,
  2. RingHom.IsIntegral,
  3. IsIntegral,
  4. Algebra.IsIntegral.

1 and 3 are defined for elements; 2 and 4 are defined for the whole ring. 1 and 2 are for ring homs; 3 and 4 are for algebras.

But we only have one IsSeparable. Its role is like Algebra.IsIntegral.

Now I want to add lemmas talking about separable elements (e.g. the sum of two separable elements is still separable). So I want to rename the current IsSeparable into Algebra.IsSeparable and add a new IsSeparable for elements, just like IsIntegral and Algebra.IsIntegral. Do you think this is a good idea? Thank you for any comments and suggestions!
I think that the reason is that docs#RingHom.IsIntegralElem would be very long to write every time, while your IsSeparableElem x would just be (minpoly F x).Separable
but I am not against having such a definition

Riccardo Brasca said:

maybe as a notation?

That would work! So maybe you prefer the first solution to the second?

  1. Add a new notation IsSeparableElem, leave IsSeparable unchanged.
  2. Rename the old IsSeparable into Algebra.IsSeparable, add IsSeparable for elements.
I think that we should follow the same convention as for IsItegral
the two notions have a lot in common
